page.title: 04The School at St.Cleer.
page.content: The land for the school was bought from the Liskeard and Caradon Railway Company and the school built in 1877. There were three classrooms for 160 children. The school cost Â£971 to build, and the two houses next door were bought for the master for Â£71. The children paid between 1d and 3d a week. Every year an inspector came. If the children passed his tests, they would go up to the next standard: if they did not pass, they would stay in the same class for another year. The master was George Noble, and he was paid Â£78 p.a. The infants teacher was paid Â£40 p.a. The playground was divided into two parts -the north half for the boys, and the south side for the girls and infants. The school was all-age until 1957, when the older children went a new secondary school at Liskeard.
